com.bigdata.rdf.sparql.ast.service.history

Class HistoryServiceFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.rdf.sparql.ast.eval.CustomServiceFactoryBase
      • com.bigdata.rdf.sparql.ast.service.history.HistoryServiceFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CustomServiceFactory, ServiceFactory

    public class HistoryServiceFactory
extends CustomServiceFactoryBase
    This service tracks KB updates via an IChangeLog and is responsible for maintaining an ordered index over the assertions that have been added to or removed from a KB instance.
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson
    See Also:
    History Service

      • getServiceOptions

        public IServiceOptions getServiceOptions()

      • create

        public ServiceCall<?> create(ServiceCallCreateParams params)
        TODO Implement: Query should support an index scan of a date range with optional filters on the (s,p,o,c) and add/remove flags. It might make more sense to index in (POS) order rather than SPO order so we can more efficiently scan a specific predicate within some date range using an advancer pattern.

        The restrictions that this service COULD apply to the index scan are:

        fromTime
        Inclusive lower bound.
        toTime
        Exclusive upper bound (e.g., the first commit point NOT to be reported).
        P
        The IV for the predicate (this is the first statement key component in the history index for both triples and quads mode KBs)
        In addition, it could filter on the remaining fields (that is, skip over tuples that fail a filter):
        S, O [, C]
        The IV for the subject, object, and (for quads mode, the context).
        action
        The ChangeAction.
        type
        The StatementTypeEnum.
        Parameters:
        params - The pararameters, which are encapsulated by this interface.
        Returns:
        The object which can be used to evaluate the SERVICE clause.

      • startConnection

        public void startConnection(BigdataSail.BigdataSailConnection conn)
        Register an IChangeLog listener that will manage the maintenance of the describe cache.
